thesis.description: Taking as a model the theory of generative grammar developed by Chomsky, and amended by Wallace Chafe, this thesis presents an analysis of museum displays in Central Kansas. Rules that generate a description of the structuring of displays are developed, partly from the displays themselves, and partly from interview material. The analysis is then related to a general model for classification shown to be similar to that developed by Levi-Strauss in The Savage Mind.
thesis.creator: Laurence, Hugh G.
thesis.subject: Anthropology.
thesis.title: A formal analysis of museum displays in Central Kansas
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The bridging or subarachnoid segment of the superficial cerebral veins is a vulnerable target for some types of intracranial disease. There is evidence that raised intracranial pressure with patent subarachnoid pathways causes compression of the bridging segment. Intracranial cerebral shift, mass lesions, infection, thrombosis, or surgical interference can have a more direct effect on this segment of the vein. Yet there has been little experimental study of the role of interference of venous flow in the brain circulation.
thesis.creator: Laurelli, Henry
thesis.subject: Neurology and Neurosurgery.
thesis.title: Experimental cerebral venous occlusion
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The in vitro procedure of inhibition of migration of peritoneal exudate cells (PEC) was adapted for the study of transplantation immunity in mice. One adaptation involved the mixture of thymus cells from mice of the graft-donor strain with PEC induced in the recipients. Small numbers of the thymus cells served as potent cellular antigens and demonstrated the immunological specificity of the assay, as revealed by inhibition of migration of the cell mixture. Thymus cells from a third-party strain sharing donor transplantation antigens caused similar inhibitions. In another approach, the addition of lymph node cells (LNC) from graft-immunized mice to PEC induced in the donor strain caused the inhibition of migration of the cell mixture in an immunologically specific fashion. Experiments showed that low numbers of LNC (1 to 2% of the population) were able to inhibit antigenic PEC demonstrating the sensitivity of this test and its applicability for the analysis of transplantation reactions at a cellular level.
thesis.creator: Lake, Philip
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: In vitro studies of transplantation immunity
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The interest in intestinal transplantation is stimulated by the recent technical success of Lellihei in transplanting the entire intestine in dogs. The ability to transplant intestine would certainly find a useful place in the surgeons' armamentarium in treating a condition which requires excision of the entire small intestine. A morphological study of intestinal mucosal changes during rejection is presented in this thesis. The intestinal mucosa was found to reject in a fashion very similar to kidney and other organ allografts with the same general survival time. Clubbing, round cell infiltration and ischemic changes (lifting of the epithelium) are characteristic changes observed during rejection. Vascular damage and occlusion of the small vessels with platelet thrombi and fibrin deposition seem to have a significant role to play in the rejection process, as shown both in the carbon injection study and electron-microscopic studies presented. Immunosuppressive studies presented show that survival of intestinal allograft can be prolonged by conventional immunosuppressive agents (Anti-thymocytic-serum and immuran). However, it seems that intestine is more difficult to immunosuppress than kidney allografts. Donor graft perfusion with ATG during operation does not seem to have any appreciable effect ln the survival of intestinal allografts.
thesis.creator: Kwan, Alan H.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: A morphological study of intestinal transplantation and the effect of donor graft pretreatment on intestinal allograft survival
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Age-related changes in the transport ATPase system of mammalian erythrocyte membranes have been investigated. Two developmental processes were followed, maturation of reticulocytes in humans, rabbits and low-potassium sheep, and development of erythrocytes during ontogeny in LK lambs. Human and rabbit erythrocytes contain similar high potassium concentrations, though human membranes exhibit more alkali cation-dependent ATPase than rabbits. In both species, a decline in this activity is observed with cell maturation. LK sheep erythrocytes have low potassium content and little Na+-dependent ATPase. Reticulocytes possess elevated potassium levels and increased ATPase activity. Both parameters decrease during maturation, but the loss of ATPase activity is due mainly to a decrease in the Mg++-dependent component. LK lamb erythrocytes possess elevated potassium content and ATPase activity. Na+-ATPase resembles HK rather than LK erythrocytes, both in quantity and K+-response kinetics. Ontogeny is associated with changes in cell potassium levels and Na+-ATPase activity to mature LK characteristics.
thesis.creator: Kuebler, Evelyn S.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Changes in erythrocyte membrane Na –ATPase associated with cell maturation and ontogeny
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The ventilatory response of supine anesthetized and conscious man and of upright exercising subjects to added linear inspiratory flow resistive loads applied at FRC has been studied. The immediate drop in ventilation was surprisingly small in the face of large loads. The role of the passive properties of the ventilatory pump in stabilizing ventilation has been studied by comparing observed volumes of the first loaded breath with volumes predicted from equations based on an electrical analogue.
thesis.creator: Iscoe, Steven D.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Ventilatory stability
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The spermatogonial stem cell population of adult rats was analyzed quantitatively in whole mounts of seminiferous tubules and in radioautographed sections of testes collected at various time intervals after injections of 3H-thymidine. Various classes of type A spermatogonia were identified on the basis of their nuclear morphology and topographical distribution along the tubular basement membrane. The data suggested that the isolated type A spermatogonia were generally non-proliferative and were possibly equivalent to the "reserve stem cells" postulated by Clermont and Bustos-Obregon (1968). Paired type A spermatogonia also appeared to belong to this class of cells. Type A1 spermatogonia, which formed linear groups of more than four cells, originated during the peak of mitosis of type A4 spermatogonia. The data indicated that the type A1 spermatogonia were produced by some type A4 cells and/or a variant of this type of cells showing an irregular lobed nucleus (A irregular). The remaining type A4 cells produced differentiated spermatogonia (Intermediate and type B) which generated spermatocytes. Type Al cells ae well ae type A2, A3 and A4, which derive from each other, thus constituted a class of "renewing stem cells".
thesis.creator: Hermo, Louis S.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: Quantitative study of the spermatogonial stem cell population of the rat
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The graft-verus-host (GVH) reaction suppresses both cellular and humoral immune responses and is often lethal. Studies were performed to determine whether the GVH reaction itself could be altered by various cell treatments. GVH reactions were induced in adult CBA X A F1 mice by the injection of various doses of parental (A strain) lymphoid cells. Later the GVH animals received either an A strain thymus graft (PTG), CAF1 thymus graft (FITG) CAF1 bone marrow cells (SM)) CAF1 spleen graft (SG), F1TG and SM) F1TG and SG) or sham thymus graft (ST). At the higher cell doses it was found that F1TG by itself, or in combination with SM or SG shortened animal survival time. SM and SG treatment prolonged animal survival time. The results suggest that SM and SG protect F1 animals from the lethal effects of the GVH reaction, whereas F1TG increases the intensity of the GVH reaction.
thesis.creator: Grushka, Miriam
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: The immunosuppressive effect of the graft-versus-host reaction in mice
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In 8 anesthetized, tracheotomized cats, at different body temperatures (range: 36 to 40°C), we have studied the immediate effect of added inspiratory elastic loads on tidal volume and respiratory frequency. At any given temperature, the addition of elastic loads resulted in a decrease in both tidal volume (VT) and respiratory frequency (f), the relationship between VT and f being given by: VT = m (f – fo), where m is a constant reflecting the vagal (lung volume-dependent) contribution to frequency, and fo ¬¬¬¬¬¬¬is the non-vagal (bulbo-pontine pacemaker) component. Indeed, following vagotomy, f was the same as the intercept fo determined at the same temperature. The log values of both fo and 1/m show a linear relationship to absolute rectal temperature on Arrenhius plots, providing average µ values of 33.8 and 33.0 Kcal/mole, respectively (corresponding to Q10 values of 6.1 and 6.0, respectively). Thus it appears that body temperature has the same effect on the contribution of both the vagal and bulbo-pontine pacemaker mechanisms controlling respiratory frequency.
thesis.creator: Grunstein, Michael M.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: A quantitative analysis of the effect of body temperature on tidal volume and respiratory frequency in anesthetized cats
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is well known that in mammals bilateral nephrectomy results in striking electrolyte changes, hypertension, changes in Gibbs-Donnan equilibria and cell swelling in many organs - consistent with permeability alterations - and progressive irreversible myocardial lesions. To determine the relationships between these events, two groups of bilaterally nephrectomized rats were studied from several points of view. One group was given tap water, and the other 0.5% NaCl to drink after nephrectomy to enhance the changes produced by electrolyte derangements and to accelerate hypertension. In a third group, special permeability alterations were studied in rats treated similarly to group l (tap water only) , but subjected also to intravenous peroxidase tracer protein in order to document altered permeability in cardiac muscle cells.
thesis.creator: Eu, Hui-Young
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: Experimental studies on cardiac lesions in renoprival hypertension
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: After injection of 125I into animals, discovery in radioautographs of some silver grains over cells of thyroid follicles continues to provoke the controversy that binding of iodine to protein might occur in cells rather than in the colloid of follicle lumens (Croft and Pitt-Rivers, 1970; Takano and Honjin , 1968). To analyze the significance of grains over cells, 10 µCi per gram body weight of Na 125I was given intravenously into adult male rats which were sacrificed in 30-45 seconds by perfusing with glutaraldehyde; over 700 photographs of EM radioautographs were examined. Quantitative studies (by drawing appropriate boundary circles about each grain to locate the probable source of radioactivity) showed that of 7736 silver grains surveyed, 85-87% were over follicie lumens (the peak being adjacent to the apical cell membrane) and 13-15% were over follicular cell cytoplasm (again, the peak being adjacent to the apical cell membrane).
thesis.creator: Chajut, Norbert R.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: The site of binding of iodine to thyroglobulin in rat thyroid follicles as revealed by quantitative electron microscope radioautography
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Bovine soluble lens protein was fractionated by a variety of Chromatographic procedures. Bio-Gel A-1.5 M gave a reproducible elution profile consisting of 5 fractions, designated l -> V. The physicochemical properties and degree of heterogeneity of the fractions were studied in dissociating and/or non dissociating solvents by the following methods: ion-exchange chromatography on DEAE-cellulose, sedimentation velocity, high-speed meniscus depletion sedimentation equilibrium, polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis, immuno-diffusion, determination of spectral quantities, amino acid analysis and sulfhydryl group estimation. Comparison of the data with the literature suggestion that Fractions I, II and III, IV, and V were a-, β-, βs- and γ-crystallin respectively. Preparative polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis in 0.1% Triton X-100 of Fraction Il, an intermediate molecular weight fraction, yielded three bands, designated P, Q and R, which were recovered from the gel. Subfractions P and Q were initially stable, forming aggregates that precipitated. Over 90% of the insoluble material could be solubilized in 8 M urea, 0.01% dithiothreitol. Deaggregation of the subfractions to similar size subunits in dissociating media was observed by analytical ultra-centrifugation.
thesis.creator: Bazar, Leonard S.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Purification and properties of bovine lenticular proteins. Partial characterization of a soluble protein fraction of intermediate molecular weight
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Cell-mediated immunity was induced by the injection of a low dose of sheep erythrocytes in Complete Freund's Adjuvant. This state of cell-mediated immunity was found to correlate with a reduce capacity of the spleen cells taken from such animals three days after priming to produce anti-sheep erythrocyte antibody in vitro. Evidence presented suggested that the depression is due to a competition between the cell mediated and humoral responses for the same thymus-derived lymphocyte. Thymus-derived lymphocytes perform a helper function in the synthesis of anti-sheep erythrocyte antibodies in mice. The helper cell could be replaced by a cell-free supernatant derived from short term culture of the thymus-derived cells with the antigen. This supernatant "factor" was shown to be heat labile, non-dialysable and immunologically specific. This finding suggested that direct cell-to-cell contact is not required in the cell co-operation in the anti-sheep erythrocyte antibody synthesis in mice.
thesis.creator: Yu, Herbert D-B.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The identity and function of thymus-derived lymphocytes in the anti-sheep red blood cell immune responses on mice
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: There are two types or sheep distinguished by the intracellular potassium level or their red blood cells, i.e. low potassium red cells and high potassium red cells. Studies by other investigators have shown that both the rate or active sodium and potassium transport and sodium- plus potassium-stimulated adenosine triphosphate hydrolysis (Na+,K+-ATPase) are approximately four times greater in high potassium than in low potassium red cells. In the present study, the sodium-stimulated adenosine triphosphatase (Na+-ATPase) enzyme system in fragmented membrane of the two cell types was compared. For HK:LK activity, the approximate activity ratios were 10 for Na+-stimulated ATPase (Na+-ATPase), 12 for Na+- plus K+-stimulated ATPase (Na+~K+-ATPase), and 2 for Na+-dependent (14C)ADP-ATP exchange; the ratio of Na+-stimulated membrane phosphorylation determined with γ-32P-ATP, was approximately 7.
thesis.creator: Whittington, Emerson S.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Comparative properties of high potassium and low potassium sheep erythrocyte membrane sodium-activated adenosine triphosphatase
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The effects of local anesthetics, procaine and mepivacaine, were examined using isolated rat liver mitochondria as a model membrane system. The effects of procaine and mepivacaine were studied on mitochondrial respiration, calcium stimulated respiration and gramicidin-induced K+ efflux and swelling. High concentrations (about 10^-3 and 10^-4 M) of procaine and mepivacaine were found to stimulate the respiratory rates and decrease the RCRs of mitochondria. High concentrations of procaine and mepivacaine also inhibited the rate of Ca++-stimulated respiration, induced by the presence of both limited and massive amounts of Ca++, under both normel stoichiometric and "superstoichiometric” conditions. High concentrations of mepivacaine inhibited gramicidin-induced K+ efflux and gramicidin-induced swelling.
thesis.creator: Weinberger, Viviane S.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The effects of the local anesthetics, procaine and mepivacaine, on rat liver Mitochondria
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The first part of this paper presents a framework for the study of perceptions of violence. It is believed that most political thinkers concern themselves with four basic issues when discussing violence; the definition of the concept, the reasons for its existence, the effects it has on normal social relations and its justification as a political tool. These four categories are explicated in the first part of the paper, and the views of different social and political thinkers are examined in the context of this framework. In the second part, this framework is applied to the writings of Pierre Trudeau and Pierre Vallières. It is shown how their views on violence reflect the worldview of a liberal (Trudeau) and a revolutionary (Vallières).
thesis.creator: Tetrault, Paul A.
thesis.subject: Political Science.
thesis.title: A suggested framework for the study of perceptions of violence and its application to the writings of Pierre Trudeau and Pierre Vallières
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Ventilatory stability in the face of mechanical loads has been studied in anesthetized rabbits, cats and dogs. In all animals, addition of elastic or flow-resistive loads resulted in an immediate decrease in ventilation. Smaller animals exhibited higher ventilatory stability to added elastic loads. However, when the loads were expressed as a percentage of the passive elastance of the respiratory system, stability was found to be similar for all animals. The relative contributions of the passive elastance and of vagal reflexes were also found to be approximately the same in all species. In addition, all animals exhibited much greater stability to a given increase in resistance than to an equivalent increase in elastance, suggesting that the properties of the respiratory system are better designed to withstand transient changes in resistance rather than in elastance.
thesis.creator: Strobach, Helene
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: A comparative study on the stability of ventilation
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis concerns the Reign of al-Wathiq, the ninth ‘Abbasid caliph (227-232/842-847), a time considered the seal of the Golden Period of the ‘Abbasid Caliphate. The thesis comprises a translation into English of the account of al-Tabarï on the reign of al-Wâthiq which has not previously been translated into any other language. The Annotations give an explanation of the important events, terms and personalities mentioned in the text, and correct some information related to certain events. The Introduction gives portraits of al-Wâthiq as viewed by other historians; the Conclusion gives a brief comment on and evaluation of the caliph in his military and civil activities.
thesis.creator: Al-Rasheed, Zamel R.
thesis.subject: Islamic Studies.
thesis.title: The reign of the Caliph al-Wathig (842-847 A.D.) according to al-Tabari’s history: an annotated translation
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Golgi apparatus of primary and secondary spermatocytes is composed of several stacks of saccules, made up of 4-8 saccules and vesicular and tubular profiles. The Golgi apparatus exhibits an hemispherical shape lying over the nucleus. During late prophase and metaphase of the first and second maturation divisions the characteristic cap shape of the organelle is undetectable. It appears instead as a single agglomeration of lamellae, vesicles and branching tubules. During anaphase this single agglomerate breaks up into small Golgi fragments which persist in early telophase. Such a Golgi fragment is composed of 2-3 short saccules either single or loosely piled up and surrounded by vesicles and tubules of various kinds. By late telophase one Golgi fragment adheres to the nucleus, while the remaining ones gather around it to form the single Golgi apparatus. After each division the Golgi apparatus is re-formed and disposed in a corona-like manner caping the nucleus. Thus the Golgi apparatus undergoes marked morphological changes during meiosis but remains present throughout the two successive divisions.
thesis.creator: Pelletier, Real J.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: Evolution of the Golgi apparatus during the meiotic divisions of mouse spermatocytes
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Utilisée d'abord par la linguistique, la méthode structurale s'est rapidement étendue aux sciences humaines. D'un point de vue anthropologique le structuralisme a heurté le marxisme de plein front. Cependant certains marxistes groupés autour de Louis Althusser ont tenté de profiter des apports du structuralisme en appliquant aux oeuvres de Marx une méthode de lecture "symptômale". Le résultat a été de nous livrer une conception de l'homme qui, si elle se rapproche de la conception structuraliste, ne nous semble pas être celle de Marx dont elle heurte l'intention globale. Une étude de la méthode structurale et de la lecture althussérienne nous révèle en effet que, sides convergences existent quant à la structure complexe des sociétés humaines, une divergence fondamentale existe quant au sujet de l'histoire et sa perception de la société. Le rejet épistémologique du concept d'homme nous apparaît comme un refus de cette possibilité du sujet.
thesis.creator: Lemay, Robert M.
thesis.subject: Philosophy.
thesis.title: Marxisme et structuralisme; l’interpretation althusserienne de Marx
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: There are many substances which have cardiac stimulant effects. Those used in therapeutics, however, are restricted to two major groups, the plant glycosides such as digitalis and the catecholamines such as isoprenaline. The effects of the glycosides on the heart are characterized by a slow onset of action and a prolonged increase in the contractile force (Thorp and Cobbin, 1967). Although of definite clinical use, glycosides have the disadvantage of a narrow margin of safety between their effective and toxic doses. Thus, in order to improve the contractility of the failing heart, it is necessary to administer a near toxic dose. The second important group of cardiac stimulant drugs, the catecholamines, have an immediate and short action which limits their use primarily to the treatment of cardiovascular emergencies. In view of the shortcomings of both of these groups, new cardiac stimulants are sought.
thesis.creator: Lee, Wendy W.
thesis.subject: Pharmacology.
thesis.title: Myocardial effects of caerulein
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The study attempts to analyse effectiveness and cost of Simple and Radical Mastectomy without or with post-operative radiation therapy in a group of 295 women treated for primary breast cancer in the Royal Victoria Hospital, Montreal, Quebec, from 1961 to 1965. In this retrospective, non-randomized study, effectiveness was assessed by 5-year relative survival rates and direct costs by expenditure for hospitalization, surgery, anesthesia, radiation therapy. Results failed to show correlation between increased survival and increased costs. With radiation therapy, survival was decreased regardless of type of treatment and stage of disease. Without radiation therapy the over-all group treated by Simple Mastectomy had a slightly increased survival over Radical Mastectomy group: inexplicably, patients' survival was increased in early disease with Radical Mastectomy and in locally advanced disease with Simple Mastectomy. Awaiting evidence for best treatment, cost could become a factor of decision in treatment of breast cancer.
thesis.creator: Lavergne, Berthe
thesis.subject: Epidemiology.
thesis.title: Cost-effectiveness analysis in treatment of breast cancer
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A reliable method of assessing glomerular filtration rate (GFR) is useful in measuring the degree of impairment of kidney function resulting from renal disease. The standard technique is the constant infusion method utilizing inulin as described by Shannon and Smith (33) in 1935. The GFR is calculated using the derivative formulation based on the equation of Van Slyke (32) modified for use with inulin, GFR = urine inulin concentration x urine volume / plasma inulin concentration x time, for each short urine collection period of 20-30 minutes. The physiological basis and inherent weaknesses of this test are described.
thesis.creator: Harries, John D.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Glomerular filtration rate measurement; a new cumulative integral method
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The exact site of termination of fibers from the paramedian lobule and Crus II was investigated by making lesions in these regions and mapping terminal degeneration with the Nauta-Laidlaw method. The paramedian lobule sends three, non-overlapping, ipsilateral projections upon the cerebellar nuclei. The first projection is located in the ventral part of the lateral nucleus (NL), the second in the caudal part of the posterior interposed nucleus (NIP), and the third projection is found in the dorsal portion of the anterior interposed nucleus (NIA) continuing through the NL-NIA transition zone. Crus II sends two ipsilateral projections upon the cerebellar nuclei: the first is located in the anterior half of the NIP, and the second in the dorsal part of the NL continuing through the NL-NIA transition zone. Within each zone of projection of the paramedian lobule and Crus II, an orderly distribution of cortico-nuclear fibers is revealed by differences in localization of degenerated fibers after lesions in different regions of the paramedian lobule and Crus II. Since both of these lobules receive an afferent input which is organized somatotopically, the topographical distribution of cortico-nuclear fibers from the paramedian lobule and Crus II means a somatotopy.
thesis.creator: Diakiw, Nathalie
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: Cortico-nuclear projections from the paramedian lobule and Crus II of the cat cerebellum; an experimental study with silver impregnation methods
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Multiple-unit activity (MUA) and average evoked potentials (AEP) were simultaneously recorded from rats performing in a "go, no-go" auditory discrimination task. Average MUA was generally less variable and better related to the animal's response than was the AEP. The lateral septal area was the only structure where the poststimulus pattern of MUA was consistently related to whether or not the animal bar pressed. Medial septal prestimulus MUA levels were highest when the animal did not subsequently bar press, while poststimulus MUA levels were always sharply reduced from the prestimulus range, regardless of stimulus or response conditions. These results were frequently independent of whether the response was correct or incorrect. The poststimulus latencies of AEP and average MUA peaks were closely related in the dorsal hippocampus and medial geniculate but were not clearly related in either septal area.
thesis.creator: Christian, John D.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Neural correlates of behavior in an auditory discrimination task
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
